Cystic Fibrosis

Final Answer: Cystic Fibrosis
Rationale:

The constellation of symptoms (chronic cough, recurrent pneumonia, failure to thrive, salty-tasting skin) is highly suggestive of cystic fibrosis (CF). CF is an autosomal recessive genetic disorder that affects the exocrine glands, leading to the production of thick, sticky mucus in various organs, including the lungs and pancreas. This mucus obstructs airways, leading to chronic lung infections and impaired nutrient absorption due to pancreatic insufficiency
